page.title: 14RHYMNEY HOUSING-VALLEYSCAPE
page.content: The housing in Rhymney,built mainly at the turn of the century,is fairly typical of the valleys of South Wales. Most houses are terraced properties, which are owner occupied or council- owned dwellings,although there are a number of semi- detached houses and an even smaller number of detached houses. The houses themselves are made either of red bricks with tiled roofs as in the case of the modern dwellings or as in older pre war housing mainly of pennant sandstone and Welsh slate roofs. The style of building is consistent with Welsh valley towns.First houses were built entirely of pennant then yellow or red brick was used for chimneys then Quoins and finally as surrounds for doors and windows form- ing the typical valley terraced house.
